hesml.taxonomy

Interface IVertex

  • All Superinterfaces:
    java.lang.Comparable<IVertex>
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    Vertex

    public interface IVertex
extends java.lang.Comparable<IVertex>
    This interface represents an abstract vertex within a taxonomy as detailed in the paper below. Lastra-Díaz, J. J., and García-Serrano, A. (2016). HESML: a scalable ontology-based semantic similarity measures library with a set of reproducible experiments and a replication dataset. Submitted for publication to the Information Systems Journal.
    Author:
    Juan Lastra-Díaz

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void computeDistanceField(boolean weighted)
      This function computes the distance field from the current vertex using the Dijkstra algorithm and the edge weights assigned to the taxonomy.
      IVertexList getAncestors(boolean includeVertex)
      This function returns the subsumer set (ancestor set) including the vertex if it is required.
      double getAsymmetricShortestPathDist(IVertex target)
      This function computes the length of the shortest path between the current vertex and the target vertex using the weights of the oriented edges, instead of the weight of the non-oriented edges.
      IVertexList getChildren()
      This function returns the children set of the vertex.
      int getChildrenCount()
      This function returns the number of child vertexes.
      int getDepthMax()
      This function returns the length of the longest ascending path length from the vertex to the root, so called DepthMax in HESML library.
      int getDepthMaxBase1()
      This function returns DepthMax + 1 for the vertex.
      int getDepthMin()
      This function returns the length of the shortest ascending path from the vertex to the root, so called DepthMin in HESMl library.
      int getDepthMinBase1()
      This function returns Depth + 1
      IHalfEdge getFirstOutcomingEdge()
      This function returns the first outcoming oriented edge as defined in the HESML paper.
      IVertexList getHyponyms(boolean vertexInclusive)
      This function returns the hyponym set subsumed by the vertex.
      double getICvalue()
      This function returns the IC-value assigned to this vertex.
      int getID()
      This function return the key ID for the vertex.
      IHalfEdge getIncidentEdge(IVertex target)
      This function returns the oriented outcoming edge pointing to the input vertex.
      int getInclusiveSubsumedLeafSetCount()
      This function returns the number of subsumed leaves including the vertex.
      double getMinDistance()
      This function returns the value of the minimum distance attribute used by the shortest path algorithm.
      IVertexList getNeighbours()
      This function gets the adjacent vertexes by computing them on-the-fly.
      int getNonInclusiveAncestorSetCount()
      This function returns the number of ancestors without to include the own base vertex.
      int getNonInclusiveHyponymSetCount()
      This function returns the pre-computed hyponym count without including the vertex.
      int getNonInclusiveSubsumedLeafSetCount()
      This function returns the cached value for the number of leaves subsumed by this vertex.
      IVertexList getParents()
      This function returns the parent list.
      int getParentsCount()
      This function returns the number of direct parents.
      java.lang.String[] getParentStringTags()
      This function returns a vector with the string tag fields of the parent vertexes.
      double getProbability()
      This function returns the probability stored in the node.
      double getShortestPathDistanceTo(IVertex target, boolean weighted)
      This function computes the Dijkstra algorithm using the edge weights assigned to the taxonomy.
      java.lang.String getStringTag()
      This function returns the content of the string Tag field
      IVertexList getSubsumedLeaves(boolean inclusive)
      This function returns the leaves set subsumed by the vertex, being computed on-the-fly.
      java.lang.Object getTag()
      This function returns the content of the user-defined Tag field.
      ITaxonomy getTaxonomy()
      This function returns the taxonomy that contains the vertex.

      This function returns the value of the first traversal flag.

      This function checks if the current vertex is a Leaf

      This function checks whether the vertex is a root node.

      This function sets the IC value for this vertex.

      This function sets the minimum distance value that is accumulated by the vertex.

      This function sets the user-defined string field.

        This function checks if the current vertex is a Leaf
        Returns:

        void setStringTag(java.lang.String strTag)
        This function sets the user-defined string field.
        Parameters:
        strTag - New free-use string attribute attached to the vertex

      • getDepthMin

        int getDepthMin()
         throws java.lang.Exception
        This function returns the length of the shortest ascending path from the vertex to the root, so called DepthMin in HESMl library. The depth takes a 0 value in the root.
        Returns:
        Depth for the vertex.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • getDepthMax

        int getDepthMax()
         throws java.lang.Exception
        This function returns the length of the longest ascending path length from the vertex to the root, so called DepthMax in HESML library. The depth takes a 0 value in the root.
        Returns:
        Longest depth value for the vertex
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • getDepthMaxBase1

        int getDepthMaxBase1()
              throws java.lang.Exception
        This function returns DepthMax + 1 for the vertex.
        Returns:
        The longest depth starting at 1, as defined by
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • getDepthMinBase1

        int getDepthMinBase1()
              throws java.lang.Exception
        This function returns Depth + 1
        Returns:
        The depth starting at 1, as defined by Zhou et al. (2008)
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • getHyponyms

        IVertexList getHyponyms(boolean vertexInclusive)
                 throws java.lang.Exception
        This function returns the hyponym set subsumed by the vertex. The hyponym set is computed on-the-fly.
        Parameters:
        vertexInclusive - Indicates whether the base vertex must be included.
        Returns:
        Hyponym set of the vertex
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - Unexpected error

      • getSubsumedLeaves

        IVertexList getSubsumedLeaves(boolean inclusive)
                       throws java.lang.Exception
        This function returns the leaves set subsumed by the vertex, being computed on-the-fly.
        Parameters:
        inclusive - The vertex will be included if it is a leaf node.
        Returns:
        The number of hyponyms
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - An unexpected exception

      • getInclusiveSubsumedLeafSetCount

        int getInclusiveSubsumedLeafSetCount()
                              throws java.lang.Exception
        This function returns the number of subsumed leaves including the vertex.
        Returns:
        Overall subsumed leaves
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - An unexpected exception

      • getAncestors

        IVertexList getAncestors(boolean includeVertex)
                  throws java.lang.InterruptedException,
                         java.lang.Exception
        This function returns the subsumer set (ancestor set) including the vertex if it is required.
        Parameters:
        includeVertex - Indicates that the current vertex will be included.
        Returns:
        Ancestor sets including the own vertex.
        Throws:
        java.lang.InterruptedException - An unexpected exception
        java.lang.Exception

      • getNonInclusiveHyponymSetCount

        int getNonInclusiveHyponymSetCount()
                            throws java.lang.Exception
        This function returns the pre-computed hyponym count without including the vertex.
        Returns:
        Number of hyponyms subsumed by the current vertex.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - Unexpected error

      • getFirstOutcomingEdge

        IHalfEdge getFirstOutcomingEdge()
        This function returns the first outcoming oriented edge as defined in the HESML paper.
        Returns:
        The first outcoming oriented edge.

      • getMinDistance

        double getMinDistance()
        This function returns the value of the minimum distance attribute used by the shortest path algorithm.
        Returns:
        The minimum accumulated distance in any Djikstra-like method

      • setMinDistance

        void setMinDistance(double minDistance)
        This function sets the minimum distance value that is accumulated by the vertex.
        Parameters:
        minDistance - New Minimum distance value.

      • getShortestPathDistanceTo

        double getShortestPathDistanceTo(IVertex target,
                                 boolean weighted)
        This function computes the Dijkstra algorithm using the edge weights assigned to the taxonomy. When the parameter 'weighted' is false, the function uses the edge length (weight = 1), otherwise it computes the weighted shortest path distance.
        Parameters:
        target - Final path vertex.
        weighted - Flag indicating the value for the weights
        Returns:
        The minimum accumulated distance to the target vertex.

      • computeDistanceField

        void computeDistanceField(boolean weighted)
        This function computes the distance field from the current vertex using the Dijkstra algorithm and the edge weights assigned to the taxonomy. When the parameter 'weighted' is false, the function uses the edge length (weight = 1), otherwise it computes the weighted shortest path distance. Once the function is executed, the distance from the vertex to each vertex in the taxonomy can be recovered by calling the getMinDistance() function on each vertex.
        Parameters:
        weighted - Flag indicating the value for the weights

      • getAsymmetricShortestPathDist

        double getAsymmetricShortestPathDist(IVertex target)
        This function computes the length of the shortest path between the current vertex and the target vertex using the weights of the oriented edges, instead of the weight of the non-oriented edges. Thus, this method allows to define an asymmetric distance between vertexes in the taxonomy.
        Parameters:
        target - Target vertex
        Returns:
        The length of the shortest path

      • getICvalue

        double getICvalue()
        This function returns the IC-value assigned to this vertex.
        Returns:
        The IC value for this vertex

      • getIncidentEdge

        IHalfEdge getIncidentEdge(IVertex target)
        This function returns the oriented outcoming edge pointing to the input vertex.
        Parameters:
        target - Target vertex for the requested outcoming oriented-edge
        Returns:
        Outcoming half-edge pointing to the target vertex.

      • getTag

        java.lang.Object getTag()
        This function returns the content of the user-defined Tag field.
        Returns:
        Tag field used by any client code

      • setTag

        void setTag(java.lang.Object tag)
        This function sets the content of the user-defined Tag field.
        Parameters:
        tag - New tag field content.

      • getNonInclusiveAncestorSetCount

        int getNonInclusiveAncestorSetCount()
                             throws java.lang.InterruptedException,
                                    java.lang.Exception
        This function returns the number of ancestors without to include the own base vertex.
        Returns:
        CachedAncestorsCount The number of ancestors without the own vertex
        Throws:
        java.lang.InterruptedException - Unexpected error
        java.lang.Exception

      • getNonInclusiveSubsumedLeafSetCount

        int getNonInclusiveSubsumedLeafSetCount()
                                 throws java.lang.Exception
        This function returns the cached value for the number of leaves subsumed by this vertex. This value does not include the own vertex if it would be already a leaf node.
        Returns:
        CachedLeavesCount The number of leaf nodes without the own vertex
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - number of ancestors

      • setICValue

        void setICValue(double newICvalue)
        This function sets the IC value for this vertex.
        Parameters:
        newICvalue - New IC value assigned to the vertex

        This function returns the probability stored in the node.
        Returns:
        The probability field value.

        This function sets the probability stored in the node.
        Parameters:
        newProbabilityValue - New probability value assigned to the vertex

      • getID

        int getID()
        This function return the key ID for the vertex.
        Returns:
        The unique ID of the vertex.

        This function checks whether the vertex is a root node.
